text: The reason it hurts so much to separate is because our souls are connected.
author: Nicholas Sparks

text: If you are brave enough to say goodbye life will reward you with a new hello.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: Life is a series of hellos and goodbyes. I'm afraid is time for goodbye again.
author: Billy Joel

text: Never say goodbye, because goodbye means going away and going away means forgetting.
author: Peter Pan

text: Parting is such sweet sorrow.
author: William Shakespeare

text: I make it easier for people to leave by making them hate me a little.
author: Cecelia Ahern

text: Leave something for someone but dont leave someone for something.
author: Enid Blyton

text: There are no goodbyes for us. Wherever you are, you will always be in my heart.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Leaving home in a sense involves a kind of second birth in which we give birth to ourselves.
author: Robert Neelly Bellah

text: A fear of the unknown keeps a lot of people from leaving bad situations.
author: Kathie Lee Gifford

text: I hope the leaving is joyful; and I hope never to return.
author: Frida Kahlo

text: I been a long time leaving but I'm going to be a long time gone.
author: Willie Nelson

text: Don't cry because it's over. Smile because it happened.
author: Dr. Seuss

text: The story of life is quicker then the blink of an eye, the story of love is hello, goodbye.
author: Jimi Hendrix

text: The sea that calls all things unto her calls me, and I must embark.
author: Kahlil Gibran

text:
Adieu! I have too grieved a heart
to take a tedious leave.
author: William Shakespeare

text: Only in the agony of parting do we look into the depths of love.
author: George Eliot

text: Every parting is a form of death, as every reunion is a type of heaven.
author: Tryon Edwards

text: Man's feelings are always purest and most glowing in the hour of meeting and of farewell.
author: Jean Paul Richter

text: Farewell! God knows when we shall meet again.
author: William Shakespeare

text: The return makes one love the farewell.
author: Alfred De Musset

text: That bitter word, which closed all earthly friendships and finished every feast of love farewell!
author: Robert Pollok
